Package it.polimi.ingsw.controller

Class CharacterController

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.controller.CharacterController
public class CharacterController extends Object
CharacterController handles a character action request by controlling if the input is correct and, if so, it constructs the input that will be given to requested character in the model package and call the corresponding method. In this way, characters methods are called only if the input is correct.

    • handleCharacterAction

      public void handleCharacterAction(List<String> args, CharacterCard characterCard, Player activePlayer) throws IllegalCharacterActionRequestedException, NotEnoughCoinsException, IllegalArgumentException
      Handles a character action request. The request is given as a list of String parameters for the specified character card and is formulated by the specified player (which is the active player of the turn). The method first control the input, then (if the input is ok) it transforms the input in a map that contains all the entries that the specified character requires and at the end it calls the character action.
      Parameters:
      args - the arguments of the character request
      characterCard - the character that the player wants to play
      activePlayer - the player who wants to play the character
      Throws:
      IllegalCharacterActionRequestedException - if the input is not correct or if the action encountered other type of errors that are character-specific
      NotEnoughCoinsException - if the player doesn't have enough coins to play the character
      IllegalArgumentException - if the player has already played a character in the turn

    • checkCharacterInput

      public boolean checkCharacterInput(List<String> args, CharacterCard characterCard) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Controls if the input of the character request is correct
      Parameters:
      args - the parameters of the request
      characterCard - the characters on which the control is based
      Returns:
      true if the input is correct, otherwise false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the character has a non-valid id

    • checkIsland

      private boolean checkIsland(String islandId)
      Check if the island contained in the request has a string exist in the game
      Parameters:
      islandId - the island, expressed as his id in a String
      Returns:
      true if the id is valid, otherwise false

    • checkRealmType

      private boolean checkRealmType(String abbreviation)
      Checks if the specified realm type, expressed by its abbreviation is valid
      Parameters:
      abbreviation - the realm type abbreviation
      Returns:
      true if the abbreviation is valid, otherwise false

    • checkRealms

      private boolean checkRealms(List<String> realmsAbbreviations, String realmsSource)
      Checks if the specified realm types, expressed by their abbreviation are valid. The specified realms source will be used to distinguish inputs that require more than one RealmType[] (for example character 10 requires a RealmType[] for the entrance and one for the dining room)
      Parameters:
      realmsAbbreviations - the realm types abbreviation
      realmsSource - the source of the realm types
      Returns:
      true if the abbreviations are valid, otherwise false
